alert.note: Alert for Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:51AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Newton and northern Johnson Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 550 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Wiederkehr Village, or 9 miles northeast of Ozark, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dillen... Carver... Devils Knob... Piercetown... Walnut... Bertha... Rosetta... Bass... Oak Grove in Johnson County... Catalpa... Fort Douglas... Yale... Crossroad... Fallsville... Swain... Haw Creek Falls Campground... Gum Springs in Newton County... Oark... Hunt... Nail... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for western, central and north central Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County
